revised_title: Revisiting the Quasi-Steady Analysis of Hovering Insect Flight
tldr: This study re-examines the aerodynamics of hovering insect flight using new data and a new theory, challenging the validity of the quasi-steady assumption. The authors argue that unsteady aerodynamic effects play a significant role in hovering flight, and they propose a generalized vortex theory to analyze the lift and power requirements of hovering insects.
